com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.controller.components

Class RailPath.Position

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bergerkiller.bukkit.tc.controller.components.RailPath.Position
  • Enclosing class:
    RailPath

    public static final class RailPath.Position
extends java.lang.Object
    Stores all the transformation information for a single position on the path. This includes the absolute world-coordinates position, the direction vector in which is moved, and the orientation 'normal' vector.

    • Field Detail

      • posX

        public double posX
        The position of the object in world-coordinates.

      • posY

        public double posY
        The position of the object in world-coordinates.

      • posZ

        public double posZ
        The position of the object in world-coordinates.

      • motX

        public double motX
        The motion unit vector. This is the direction in which the object moves forwards over the path.

      • motY

        public double motY
        The motion unit vector. This is the direction in which the object moves forwards over the path.

      • motZ

        public double motZ
        The motion unit vector. This is the direction in which the object moves forwards over the path.

      • upX

        public double upX
        The orientation 'up' unit vector. This is the direction the object's top-side faces while traveling over the rails. It is interpolated and calculated from the rail path roll values.

      • upY

        public double upY
        The orientation 'up' unit vector. This is the direction the object's top-side faces while traveling over the rails. It is interpolated and calculated from the rail path roll values.

      • upZ

        public double upZ
        The orientation 'up' unit vector. This is the direction the object's top-side faces while traveling over the rails. It is interpolated and calculated from the rail path roll values.

      • reverse

        public boolean reverse
        Whether we are walking the path in reverse. This is important when applying the south-east rule when encountering an orthogonal rail path intersection.

      • relative

        public boolean relative
        Whether this position is relative to the rails (true), or absolute world coordinates (false). Property is automatically switched when makeRelative(Block) or makeAbsolute(Block) are used.
